children.subject:
No - you need to read the reserve seating & enrollment information in the post above. Since you are not one of the 'preferred' student groups, you will remain on the wait list until the adjustment period.

You can also learn more here: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy
Do we have to get the college's approval (permission code) in order to enroll CS 61A? I am currently a transfer Applied Mathematics student. I am #11 on the waitlist currently
I'm currently on the waitlist as #11 and was wondering when all of the seats for CS 61A will be opened.

history.content:
IMPORTANT NOTE!

Until I get approval from the Dean to exceed room capacity, I'm unable to open ALL the seats for CS 61A. I'm capped by the room size for Stanley Hall (292 seats).

I've allocated some seats in each category of reserve requirement groups and everyone else will be able to wait list. Once I'm able to increase the class size, people on the wait list who meet the requirement groups will be moved into the class. Hopefully that will happen by the end of this week.

If you want to view the requirement groups who get priority access to seating, see classes.berkeley.edu and view the RESERVED SEATS section: https://classes.berkeley.edu/content/2019-fall-compsci-61a-001-lec-001

By the end of the week, total enrollment is expected to be 1766 seats with the following breakdown during phases 1 & 2:

EECS/(MSE or NE), or Eng Undec = 425 seats

L&S Und or Cog Sci,1-4 or Tran  = 1311 seats
BioE or BioE/MSE or Engin Und = 30 seats 
These reserves will come down on 8/19 which is the first day of the adjustment period. At that time, the wait list will process students into open seats based on wait list order. If you are NOT in one of the populations listed above and you really want into the class, then you may want to add yourself to the wait list during phase 1 to position yourself well on the wait list. 
In the past this class has expanded to accommodate everyone on the wait list but that is no guarantee it will happen during F19. 
To enroll, select the lecture AND the 999 and 999A sections.
Time conflicts will be allowed for this class. This class will be webcast.
